Chippindale, P. T., A. H. Price, and D. M. Hillis. 1993. A new species of perennibranchiate salamander (EURYCEA:Plethodontidae) from Austin, Texas. Herpetologica 49:248-59.
habitat_description: The Barton Springs salamander were first described in 1993 from Barton Springs pool, a spring-fed swimming hole in the city of Austin, Travis County, Texas. The species is only known from that location and three other places in the vicinity (Chippindale et al. 1993). Individuals occupy spring outflows fed by the Barton Springs segment of the Edwards Aquifer. The species appears to be mainly surface dwelling, but may also occupy subterranean habitat (Chippindale et al. 1993). This species appears to dwell in surface waters at depths from a few centimeters to five meters (Green et al. 2013).
